attributes.action: Reverse the Decision to Scrap the Gender Recognition Act Consultation Results
attributes.additional_details:
Under current legislation, the process to obtain gender recognition is laborious and often traumatic. In 2017, May pledged to allow people to legally change their gender without medical checks. 

Following the public consultation on the Gender Recognition Act (GRA), the Government’s response was due in July and now presented in a leaked document. 

The Government reportedly plan to ditch self-ID (despite 70% of 100,000 GRA respondents in favour of it), thus denying trans people their identities.
attributes.background: We demand the results of the public consultation to be published and for it's results to be respected in reforming the Gender Recognition Act (GRA).

rejection.details:
Reform the Gender Recognition Act: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327108

Uphold current legal protections for transgender individuals and under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318175

Do not ban gender transition treatments for under 18s:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318025

Add gender identity to the characteristics protected under the Equality Act 2010:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/301138

Require schools and colleges to have gender neutral toilets:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/302997

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts:
